ml.alternet.parser.util

Interface TraversableRule

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    TraversableRule.CombinedRule, TraversableRule.SelfRule, TraversableRule.SimpleRule
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Grammar.AtLeast, Grammar.AtMost, Grammar.Bounds, Grammar.CharToken, Grammar.CharToken.Composed, Grammar.CharToken.Single, Grammar.Choice, Grammar.Combine, Grammar.Drop, Grammar.EnumToken, Grammar.EnumValueToken, Grammar.GrammarToken, Grammar.Number, Grammar.Optional, Grammar.Proxy, Grammar.Proxy.Deferred, Grammar.Proxy.Named, Grammar.Repeatable, Grammar.Rule, Grammar.Sequence, Grammar.StringToken, Grammar.Token, Grammar.TypedToken, Grammar.TypedToken.Number, Grammar.TypedToken.String, Grammar.Wrapper, Grammar.ZeroOrMore

    public interface TraversableRule
    This interface is used by Rules in order to traverse them.
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard
    See Also:
    Grammar.Rule

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  TraversableRule.CombinedRule
      Algorithm for traversing a combined rule, that is to say a rule made of several rules.
      static interface  TraversableRule.SelfRule
      Just return this rule when traversing.
      static interface  TraversableRule.SimpleRule
      Algorithm for traversing a single rule : can be used for an out-of-the-box rule as well as for a wrapped rule.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isGrammarField()
      Indicates whether this rule is defined as a field in a grammar.
      Grammar.Rule traverse(Grammar.Rule hostRule, Set<Grammar.Rule> traversed, BiFunction<Grammar.Rule,Grammar.Rule,Grammar.Rule> transformer, Function<Grammar.Rule,Grammar.Rule> targetRule)
      Traverse this rule and apply a transformer on each subrules, that is to say recursively apply the function to the rules that are composing this rule, otherwise do nothing ; if the function change a rule, it must be replaced by the new one.

    • Method Detail

      • traverse

        Grammar.Rule traverse(Grammar.Rule hostRule,
                      Set<Grammar.Rule> traversed,
                      BiFunction<Grammar.Rule,Grammar.Rule,Grammar.Rule> transformer,
                      Function<Grammar.Rule,Grammar.Rule> targetRule)
        Traverse this rule and apply a transformer on each subrules, that is to say recursively apply the function to the rules that are composing this rule, otherwise do nothing ; if the function change a rule, it must be replaced by the new one. The changes can be applied to this rule or on a clone according to a supplier.

        Implementation details

        A concrete rule has to implement this method, to allow visiting its internals. The idea is to traverse a rule once, by applying a specific task (performed by a transformer) on its components rules, and then to recursively traverse the result. If necessary, the transformation may be applied on itself or a clone, according to the targetRule supplier. Sometimes rules are composed of just another rule, such as Grammar.Optional, or by several rules, such as Grammar.Choice ; you can examine the code of the relevant classes, respectively TraversableRule.SimpleRule and TraversableRule.CombinedRule that traverse a single nested rule or a list of nested rules.
        Parameters:
        hostRule - The host rule in the hierarchy that is declared as a field in a grammar, that is to say that has a name.
        traversed - Each time a rule is traversed, it must be stored in this set to avoid traversing it again during recursion.
        transformer - (hostRule, subRule) -> transformedRule The function that transform a subRule, must return that argument to keep it unchanged. The hostRule is the nearest enclosing rule that has a name (that is to say which is a grammar field).
        targetRule - (thisRule) -> sameRuleOrClone Supply the rule on which the changes have to be applied : typically the rule itself or a clone of it. The argument of this function is this rule.
        Returns:
        The rule on which the changes were performed, given by the targetRule (this rule or a clone of this rule), or this rule if no changed were performed. The resulting rule must be of the same type of the original.

      • isGrammarField

        boolean isGrammarField()
        Indicates whether this rule is defined as a field in a grammar.
        Returns:
        true if this rule has a name false otherwise.
